value.title: Let's Talk Paginated Reports In Power BI (Premium)
value.excerpt: Join us live as we talk about where Paginated Reports in Power BI fit in. There is a place for paginated reports and you may not be aware of it!  游닉 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level? We have training courses available
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/roNBmS398WQ" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Leverage the Microsoft Fabric Trial
value.excerpt: Did you know that Microsoft Fabric comes with a 60-day free Fabric Capacity trial? Adam shows you how to get it and the reason why you may not be able to use it.  Microsoft Fabric (Preview) trial https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/get-started/fabric-trial  游닉 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/VdwsJ-Ix-oc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Leveraging OneLake Explorer - The OneDrive of Data! (Microsoft Fabric)
value.excerpt: It's been said that OneLake is the OneDrive of data in Microsoft Fabric! OneLake Explorer makes that even more so. Patrick walks you through how this works and how you can leverage it today!  OneLake File Explorer https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/onelake/onelake-file-explorer  游닉 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Link from a Power BI Paginated report to a Power BI report
value.excerpt: Patrick looks at how you can add a link to your Power BI Paginated report and open a Power BI report while passing filters over to explore data.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube -- Snapchat - guyinacube --

value.title: Make navigation easier with Power BI buttons
value.excerpt: Power BI buttons got a little more power! Navigation actions for Power BI buttons really streamline your reports and no longer require bookmarks.   Power BI Desktop Samples: https://github.com/microsoft/powerbi-desktop-samples  游닉 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

value.title: Multi-select Dynamic Titles in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: After the dynamic titles in Power BI Desktop video, we had questions about how to do multi-select values. Patrick shows you how to do it!  Demo files: https://guyinacu.be/demofiles  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba

value.title: No Calendar Table? How to add Fiscal Month and Sort in Power BI?
value.excerpt: Thinking you don't need a date table in Power BI? What about Fiscal month? Patrick shows how you could potentially go about adding that without a full date table.  But really, use a central date table 游땙  Do you need a date table for time intelligence in Power BI? Nope! (Quick Measures) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2f7dYB1l84g

value.title: Parameterize your Notebooks in Azure Synapse
value.excerpt: Using notebooks in Azure Synapse Analytics? Do you find yourself wanting to have a dynamic value for use with your pipelines? Patrick shows you how you can accomplish this!  游닉 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level?

value.title: Parameters and Templates with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows a way you can use parameters and templates, with Power BI Desktop, to provide prompts for your connection's server and database properties.   This is great for when you are creating a report, and need to share it with a customer that may have a different name for the server

value.title: Power BI Apps for Consumers
value.excerpt: Adam looks at how you can use Power BI Apps as a consumer of dashboards and reports. Power BI Apps are the main way that dashboards and reports are distributed widely in your organization.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba

value.title: Power BI dataflows: Where does it fit in? (Matthew Roche schools Patrick)
value.excerpt: Matthew Roche (@SQLAllFather) helps Patrick to understand where Power BI dataflows fits in. Does it replace enterprise data warehousing? We will explore that.  Connect with Matthew: Twitter: https://twitter.com/sqlallfather Blog: https://ssbipolar.com/   Guy in a Cube courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses

value.title: Power BI Desktop And Role-Playing Dimensions: Can you do it?
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick talks about Power BI Desktop and role-playing dimensions. Can you even do this in Power BI Desktop? Patrick shows you why one particular way is not recommended as it will cause trouble. And then show you how you can use DAX within Power BI Desktop to take this to the next level.

value.title: Power BI Desktop: How to find the native query after query folding
value.excerpt: Have you wondered how to find the native query in Power BI Desktop after query folding does its thing? Do you even know what query folding is? In this video, Adam looks at how you can find the query that will be sent to your data source and a few things to be aware of. This applies to Power Query in

value.title: Power BI Publish to Web can be SCARY!?!
value.excerpt: Some don't realize that Power BI Publish to Web is not secure. Adam shows you that this is the case. It's a bit scary and there are other options to have secure embedding.  Two Alex's Video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S3tWcCcZilw  Patrick's SharePoint video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kevw0PFnFD8

value.title: Power BI: Use DAX to get relative dates
value.excerpt: Patrick looks at how you can get relative dates, in Power BI Desktop, without using the relative date slicer or relative date filters. You just need to sprinkle a little DAX into Power BI Desktop to get this going!  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

value.title: Power BI XMLA Endpoint: Why you should care
value.excerpt: The XMLA Endpoint in Power BI can be very powerful. Adam looks at what it is and how to get started with it. If you are using Power BI Premium or Premium Per User, you need to know about this! value.title: Publish/Migrate your RDL files from Power BI Report Server to the service

value.title: Reduce the queries being sent with Incremental Refresh in Power BI!
value.excerpt: Have you noticed some extra queries being sent when using Incremental Refresh in Power BI? Patrick explains why this could happen and a potential workaround. value.title: Slicers vs. Slicer Pane vs. Filter Pane! Which is faster?
value.excerpt: You have different options in Power BI when it comes to slicers and filters. Just put the slicer on the report, use a slicer panel or have them in the filter pane. But which one is faster??? Patrick explores a few scenarios to think about!  Should you hide the filter pane in Power BI? https://greyskullanalytics.com/should-you-hide-the-filter-pane-in-power-bi/

value.title: Source Control with Power BI - Can it be done?
value.excerpt: Can we use source control, or version control, with Power BI? We get this question ALL THE TIME! Adam walks you through what your options are and how this works today with Power BI.  ALM Toolkit: http://alm-toolkit.com/  Tabular Editor: https://tabulareditor.com/  Latest updates for Deployment Pipelines:

value.title: The Power BI Smart Narrative visual is INSANE AMAZING!
value.excerpt: The smart narrative visual can help tell the story in your Power BI report. Justyna Lucznik joins us to explore the visual and to illustrate how you can generate text about your data.  Make sure you have the September 2020 version of Power BI Desktop, or later.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-smart-narrative

value.title: Visualize Graph Data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you wondered how to visualize graph data? No, not Microsoft Graph. Graph Networks! Adam shows you how you can do this in Power BI Desktop.  Download sample: http://guyinacu.be/graphdatasample  Microsoft Graph API: https://docs.microsoft.com/graph/overview  Graphs and Networks https://www.mathworks.com/help/matlab/graph-and-network-algorithms.html

value.title: What are Power BI data connectors and why should you care?
value.excerpt: You need a connector to work with data in Power Query for Power BI or Excel. But what is a connector? Adam explains what these are and how to find out what's available.  Power Query Connectors: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-query/connectors/  Power BI data sources: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/connect-data/power-bi-data-sources

value.excerpt: Confused about what a Power BI Gateway cluster is? Have your On-Premises Data Gateway installed but it's overloaded? This video is for you!
